intro: Euphrasia tatarica var. ericetorum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is known for its medicinal properties, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators.
